column2: You approve of your son's plan.
This time he has gone too far. You will sink his precious ship.
You blame the rival family for the death of your child.
You refuse the formation of the Hanseatic League.
You decide that enough lives have been lost - this feud between your families must come to an end.
This will be the start of a great vendetta between your two families...
You cannot forgive the crimes committed against your family.
You shake his hand, ending the feud.
You approve the plan.
You reject the plan as being too risky.
You leap over the railing and swim to the safety of the shore.
As the only survivors of the battle, the two of you drift aimlessly on the sea...
You make it clear to your daughter that continuing this relationship is out of the question.
You make it clear to your son that continuing this relationship is out of the question.
You stay at home, fiddling your thumbs.
You tell your crew to give the other ship the right of way.
You decide to just forget about this whole thing.
You permit the formation of the Hanseatic League.
Despite your previous anger, you decide to not to forbid this young couple from seeing each other.
You disapprove of your son's plan.
You decide not to abandon your former rival to the mercy of these pirates.
You order your daughter to end this disgraceful affair.
You decide not to move against the Trade Post.
